isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-8609 SERIES - INSTALL - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Place the mainshaft assembly into position in the case ( Figure 199).

figure.caption: Figure 199. Place Mainshaft Assembly into Position

step1.para: Install the bushing in the pocket of the input shaft ( Figure 200).

figure.caption: Figure 200. Install Bushing in Pocket of Input Shaft

step1.para: Mesh the marked tooth of the left countershaft drive gear with either set of two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 201). Install the input shaft through the bore of the case and onto the mainshaft ( inset). This will prevent the mainshaft assembly from dropping to the bottom of the case. Install the input shaft in the splines of the drive gear by moving the drive gear forward against the inside wall of the case.

figure.caption: Figure 201. Mesh Marked Tooth of Left Countershaft Drive Gear With Marked Teeth on Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Center the mainshaft in the case rear bore and install the auxiliary drive gear on the splines of the mainshaft ( Figure 202).

figure.caption: Figure 202. Install Auxiliary Drive Gear on Splines of Mainshaft

step1.para: Seat the auxiliary drive gear bearing in the rear bore of the case ( Figure 203).

figure.caption: Figure 203. Seat Auxiliary Drive Gear Bearing in Rear Bore of Case

step1.para: Install the lower bearing retainer plates ( Figure 204). Tighten bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m) and bend the lock tangs ( inset).

figure.caption: Figure 204. Install Lower Bearing Retainer Plates

step1.para: Move mainshaft assembly to the rear to expose the snap ring groove on the rear of the mainshaft and install the snap ring ( Figure 205).

figure.caption: Figure 205. Move Mainshaft Assembly to Rear

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the snap ring groove inside the drive gear ( Figure 206).

figure.caption: Figure 206. Install Snap Ring in Snap Ring Groove

step1.para: Install the drive gear spacer on the input shaft, chamfered side to the front ( Figure 207).

figure.caption: Figure 207. Install Drive Gear Spacer on Input Shaft

step1.para: Install the drive gear bearing on the input shaft and into the case bore ( Figure 208).

figure.caption: Figure 208. Install Drive Gear Bearing on Input Shaft

step1.para: Install the bearing retainer snap ring ( Figure 209).

figure.caption: Figure 209. Install Bearing Retainer Snap Ring

step1.para: Install the front bearing cover and gasket, making sure to align the oil return hole in the case with the hole in the cover ( Figure 210). Secure the bearing cover on the case with four bolts and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m) (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 210. Install Front Bearing Cover and Gasket

step1.para: Engage the 3rd-4th speed sliding clutch into the 3rd speed mainshaft gear ( Figure 211). This will prevent the 4th speed gear from dropping far enough to cause a possible timing error.

figure.caption: Figure 211. Engage 3rd-4th Speed Sliding Clutch into 3rd Speed Mainshaft Gear

step1.para: Mesh the marked timing tooth of the right countershaft drive gear with the two marked timing teeth of the main drive gear, making sure the left countershaft remains in time ( Figure 212).

figure.caption: Figure 212. Mesh Marked Tooth of Right Countershaft Drive Gear With Marked Teeth of Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Hold the countershaft in position and partially install the front and rear countershaft bearings ( inset, Figure 213) in the case bores and on countershafts.

figure.caption: Figure 213. Partially Install Front and Rear Countershaft Bearings

step1.para: Shift the mainshaft sliding clutches into all the gear positions with a screwdriver ( Figure 214). If a clutch cannot be shifted into a gear, it indicates that the gear set is out of time. The right countershaft bearings would then need to be removed and the countershaft retimed with the mainshaft. The front box is properly timed if the sliding clutches can be shifted into all the mainshaft gears.

figure.caption: Figure 214. Shift Mainshaft Sliding Clutches into All Gear Positions

note.para: Do not shift the transmission into two gears at the same time. This will prevent the transmission from rotating.

step1.para: Use a flanged bearing driver to complete seating both the front ( inset, Figure 215) and the rear countershaft bearings.

figure.caption: Figure 215. Complete Seating of Front and Rear Countershaft Bearings

step1.para: Install the snap ring into the groove into the rear bore of the case ( Figure 216).

figure.caption: Figure 216. Install Snap Ring into Groove in Rear Bore of Case

step1.para: Install the upper bearing retainer plate on the auxiliary drive gear. Tighten the two bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m) ( Figure 217) and secure by bending the lock tangs ( inset).

figure.caption: Figure 217. Install Upper Bearing Retainer Plate and Bend Lock Tangs
